results.title: Stanley Kubrick: inside the mind of a visionary filmmaker
results.brief_description:
“Stanley Kubrick: inside the mind of a visionary filmmaker” was an ACMI Screen Gallery Exhibition; 25 November 2005 - 29 January 2006. See Exhibition activity record “Stanley Kubrick : Inside the mind of a visionary filmmaker” for more information

A landmark international exhibition featuring over 1000 objects from Kubrick’s archives, including props, costumes and models from 2001: A Space Odyssey, A Clockwork Orange and The Shining.

results.title: Stanley & Iris = Stanley and Iris
results.creator_credit: Martin Ritt, Alex Winitsky, Arlene Sellers, Lantana Productions and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: A feel-good romantic drama with a social conscience, “Stanley & Iris” tackles the serious problem of illiteracy which affects one out of every five American adults. Recently widowed and working mother of two teenage children, Iris (Jane Fonda) is struggling, both financially and emotionally. Stanley (Robert DeNiro) lives alone with his elderly father and is unable to read or write, a problem he has lived with for his entire life. The two meet when Stanley comes to the aid of Iris after her handbag is stolen, soon discovering that they are co-workers from the same local commercial bakery. And so begins a friendship. However, it is not long before Iris becomes aware of Stanley’s problem and when he eventually loses his job because of his illiteracy, Stanley asks for Iris’s help in teaching him to read. The bond of friendship and support gradually draws Stanley and Iris together into an affair of the heart. Strong performances by DeNiro and Fonda provide depth and soul into what could have been a somewhat schmaltzy and overly sentimental film. Cast also includes Swoosie Kurtz, Martha Plimpton, Harley Cross, Jamey Sheridan, Feodor Chaliapin. Based on the novel “Union Street” by Pat Barker, screenplay by Harriet Frank, Jr and Irving Ravetch.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Martin Ritt, Alex Winitsky, Arlene Sellers, Lantana Productions and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer

results.title: Stanislavsky: maker of the modern theater
results.creator_credit: Harold Mantell, Mosfilm and Films for the Humanities
results.brief_description: Explores the life, times and ideas of the theatrical innovator, Constantine Stanislavsky, who created method acting and founded the Moscow Art Theatre. Uses documentary footage, photographs, and dramatisations to show his memorable roles, his search for reality in character portrayal, and his staging of plays of Chekhov, Ostrovsky, Ibsen, Maeterlinch, Gorki and Turgeniev. Narrated by Paul Rogers.

results.title: Stani the tortoise
results.brief_description: A small boy is invariably late for school because he stops to watch things that interest him on the way. the problem is solved by impressing on him that school is merely another way of learning about interesting things - and by arranging for two schoolmates to meet him every morning and walk to school with him.

results.title: Standing waves on transmission lines
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Radio Technician Training”.
By means of animated diagrams, laboratory demonstrations, and diverse analogies explains the causes, results, and prevention of standing waves in radio high frequency transmission lines.

results.title: Standing Up for Joe (TEFC)
results.brief_description: A film about conductive therapy in Hungary. A little used but successful program for cerebral palsy. Shows parents of young children going to Hungary and becoming involved in a successful program leading to some level of independence for the child.

results.title: Standing room only
results.creator_credit: Sidney Meyers, Isaac Kleinerman and CBS News
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
Considers the implications of the world’s burgeoning population growth depicting ideas for distributing food surpluses, exploiting the oceans, increasing agricultural activity. Examines several of the procedures including birth control whereby this growth can be controlled. Reporter: Walter Cronkite.

results.title: Standing in the shadows of Motown [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Paul Justman, Sandy Passman and Rimshot Productions
results.brief_description: This award winning, acclaimed documentary is in part a biographical profile of the Funk Brothers, the Hitsville studio band originally assembled by Berry Gordy in 1959, who played behind numerous Motown Records hits, but whose talents went largely unsung. In this work remaining band members are reunited to reminisce about past glories and those departed, and in order to stage a concert that celebrates their contribution to music. Using archival footage, this work also addresses the cultural revolution of the rhythm and blues movement of the 1950s and the racism and inequities that saw the originators of the music, principally African Americans, languish whilst their white counterparts (such as Elvis Presley) prospered. In Detroit the Funk brothers overcame these hurdles with a new sound - known as Motown - that not only championed their artistry but also were phenomenally successful, producing hit after hit. Musicians featured in the reunion concert include: Joan Osborne, Ben Harper, Me’Shell Ndege Ocello, Chaka Khan, Bootsy Collins and the Funk Brothers.
